reviewText: Good collection of classic African American action movies
the quality of the video you can tell they were experimenting with color with the camera. I have not saw all of this dvd but I entend to. great classic to own.
The movies on these discs are very poor quality. I would recommend trying to find an alternative source before purchasing this set.
loved it great old classic movie from 70's black action movie genre. laughed all through the movie. was just a kid when it first featured in the 70's.

Black Action Cinema is a collection of nine black action movies that have only one thing in common: they are all public domain and as such it is possible for them to be presented in highly affordable collections. I paid $9.98 for my set and that comes down to about a dollar per movie. The way that movie tickets cost nowadays, you really cannot complain about this collection.

An added bonus of this collection is the fact that many of these movies are not available on other public domain collections. Another is that you get the entire Black Cobra Trilogy starring Fred Williamson as Robert Malone.  Black Action Cinema is a great 9 movie collection.

Anyways, here is how I rate the movies in Black Action Cinema:

Great:

The Black Cobra Trilogy

Good:

The Baron (1988)
Velvet Smooth (1976)
Mean Johnny Barrows (1975)
TNT Jackson (1975)

Average:

Final Comedown (1972)

Bad:

Black Fist(1977)
